title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (October 7, 2019).

At least one additional whistleblower with firsthand knowledge of the circumstances around Trump's July call with his Ukrainian counterpart has come forward.

Barr is stoking tensions in foreign capitals, going outside usual channels to seek help in reviewing the origins of a U.S. probe begun during the 2016 campaign.

The NBA faces a furor over a team executive's tweet supporting Hong Kong's pro-democracy movement. flaring across the city

Authorities are racing to drain water from swollen reservoirs on the Upper Missouri River to prepare for next year's flood season.

Years of economic mismanagement and corruption in Iraq have led to protests that have killed nearly 100 people.

U.S. forces are expected to withdraw from northern Syria in advance of an expected incursion of Turkish forces. flaring across the city

Trump's hopes for a deal to denuclearize North Korea were set back when it demanded a significant U.S. concession.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 07, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
